section.p: You are standing at the bottom of the Devil’s Peak. It is a massive tower of black rock, like a stone tree-trunk, bare and branchless, climbing up into the sky. You cannot see the top, for it is shrouded in grey clouds. Thunder and lightning play about the clouded summit.

The sides of the peak are almost sheer, but there are many hand and footholds. It can be climbed, but only if you have some climbing gear.
